intro: Pseudoxandra xylopiifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pseudoxandra, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its small white flowers are typically clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, round berries. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest undergrowth.
